title: experts - help me find this typeface
content: I know there is at least one (maybe several) faces which contain mixed serifs. For example, it might have curved serifs on the acenders & slab serifs on the bases, spurs, etc. any names you could give me would be very helpful. thanks.
author: jefferson24

comments.content:
Look at Fleischmann derivatives.  
Mercury probably has the most variance, with like four kinds of terminals I think.

hhp
Dante mixes bracketed, dished serifs at the base of letters with wedge shaped top serifs

I think I'm asking a more simple question. I'm looking for any faces that communicate duality or, old -\>new, through a mixing of opposite type elements. So any face that integrates, sans & serifs, or curved and bracketed serifs, or very modern integrated with classical elements. If you have any others that would be great. Thanks.

Oh, you mean grunge stuff, like Fudoni.  
I don't think people do that very much any more.

hhp

Emgre's Dead History comes to mind, of course:

[http://www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=88](http://web.archive.org/web/20110508024016/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=88 "http://www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=88")
